title: Top 10 Universities for Law and Legal studies in the US other than Ivy League schools
description: Top US law schools beyond the Ivy League, such as Stanford, NYU, and UC Berkeley, offer prestigious programs in fields like environmental, tax, and intellectual property law. With tuition fees ranging from $42,000 to $75,000, these institutions provide students with specialized education and excellent career prospects in various legal domains.

title: SSC CGL Tier 1 Answer Key 2024: Objection window extended till Oct 8, direct link here
description: The Staff Selection Commission has extended the deadline for raising objections to the provisional answer key for the SSC CGL 2024 Tier 1 exam to October 8 due to heavy server traffic. Candidates can visit ssc.gov.in to submit objections with a fee of Rs 100 per question. The original deadline was October 6.

title: ONGC Recruitment 2024: Registration begins for 2236 apprentice posts, check direct link, eligibility and other details
description: ONGC has officially announced the Apprentice Recruitment 2024 for 2,236 vacancies. Eligible candidates with qualifications such as BA, BCom, BSc, BBA, BE, and BTech can apply online between October 5, 2024, and October 25, 2024. Selection is merit-based, deriving from qualifying exam marks. Results are expected on November 15, 2024.

title: IBPS RRB Clerk Mains Admit Card 2024 Released at ibpsonline.ibps.in, direct link to download here
description: IBPS has issued the IBPS RRB Clerk XIV 2024 mains admit card on October 6 for candidates eligible for the October 13 exam. Candidates can download it from ibps.in using their registration details. The exam will have 190 questions to be answered within 160 minutes, covering multiple subjects.

title: JSCC CGL 2024: #Cancel_JSSC_CGL trends as aspirants demand cancellation of Jharkhand graduate-level recruitment exam
description: The JSSC CGL 2024 exam faces allegations of paper leaks and repeated questions, sparking protests across Jharkhand. Aspirants demand the exam's cancellation, citing corruption and mismanagement. The commission has delayed results, calling for solid evidence from complainants by October 7. Pressure mounts on the state government to ensure a fair resolution.

title: DU offers dual-degree with regular and distance courses: Will students bite off more than they can chew? Pros and cons to consider
description: Delhi University now permits students to earn two degrees simultaneously, one through regular courses and another via Open and Distance Learning. This offers flexibility but may increase workload and stress. Students must meet academic criteria for both degrees individually and carefully plan to avoid burnout.

title: State reminds pvt med colleges to follow SC mandate, resume admissions; colleges wait for assurance on fee reimbursements
description: Private medical colleges in Maharashtra have halted MBBS and BDS admissions from October 1, demanding assurance from the state government on timely reimbursement of funds. The colleges claim they are owed Rs 30-50 crores annually and are struggling to manage increasing costs and teachers' salaries.

title: Indian and Nigerian youth are shaping the future together through cultural exchanges, entrepreneurship, women empowerment
description: A virtual conference between Indian and Nigerian youths explored cultural exchanges, entrepreneurship, and women empowerment. Officials emphasized leveraging historical ties and enhancing academic collaborations through education reforms and micro-financing to build a prosperous future for both nations.

title: Odisha govt recruits 16,000 junior teachers in a single day, aims to improve quality of education
description: The Odisha government has recruited 16,009 junior teachers across the state, with appointments handed out at a Kalinga Stadium event attended by Chief Minister Mohan Majhi and Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan. The recruitment aims to enhance education quality and fulfil governmental promises.

title: Survey shows 90% of Indian employees contacted outside work hours: 7 psychology-backed tips to disconnect and recharge after work
description: A survey by Indeed reveals that over 90% of Indian employees are contacted outside work hours, leading to severe work-life balance challenges. With 79% fearing missed promotions for ignoring after-hours communication, experts urge 'right to disconnect' policies to mitigate burnout and stress.

title: RUHS BSc Nursing Result 2024 declared for Semester I Main exam, direct link to download here
description: RUHS announced the B.Sc. Nursing I Semester (Main) exam results for 2024 on October 5. Students can check their scores on ruhsraj.org or bscnursing2024.com. The exam took place on August 11, and the application process ran from June 25 to July 19. Follow the given steps to access the result online.

title: How Princeton University's Aid Program Works? All you need to know
description: Princeton University offers need-based financial aid, ensuring that applying for aid does not disadvantage students during admission. The university follows a need-blind policy, assessing each family's financial circumstances individually. Full financial need is met through grants, not loans, making Princeton accessible to low- and middle-income students without academic or athletic merit considerations. Check important details here.

title: UPSC IFS Mains exam date 2024 announced: Check full schedule here
description: UPSC has announced the Indian Forest Service (IFS) Main Exam 2024 schedule. The exam will be conducted from November 24 to December 1, 2024, in two shifts: 9:00 AM to 12:00 PM (forenoon) and 2:30 PM to 5:30 PM (afternoon). Candidates qualifying for prelims will be eligible for the Mains. Check the full schedule here.

title: Goa HSSC Board exam date 2025 postponed to avoid clash with JEE Main January exams, check official notice here
description: The Goa Board of Secondary and Higher Secondary Education (GBSHSE) has rescheduled the Goa HSSC Class 12 board exams for 2025 to avoid a clash with JEE Mains. Originally set for February 1, the exams will now begin on February 10 and end on February 24, giving students more time to prepare.

title: IIM Bangalore vs IIM Mumbai:  Who leads the placement race? A comparative analysis
description: IIM Bangalore and IIM Mumbai, both top-ranked in the NIRF 2024 management category, are renowned for their academic excellence and campuses. However, a key differentiator between the two is their placement records. In this article, we’ll compare the placement performances of these premier institutes to determine which excels in offering better career opportunities.

title: Should students be signed up for tuition centres below 16? Rajasthan government's proposed Coaching Bill sparks debate
description: In India, rising student suicides linked to intense academic pressure, particularly in coaching hubs like Kota, have prompted government intervention. New guidelines aim to restrict coaching enrolment for students under 16, sparking debate over potential benefits and challenges. While aimed at enhancing mental well-being and promoting holistic learning, these restrictions may hinder early preparation for competitive exams.

title: SBI SCO Recruitment 2024 registration date extended till October 14, check direct link here
description: The State Bank of India (SBI) has extended the registration deadline for Specialist Cadre Officer (SCO) posts to October 14, 2024. Interested candidates can apply on the official SBI website, sbi.co.in. SBI aims to fill 1,497 SCO positions across various departments through this recruitment drive. Check important details here.

title: SSC CGL tier 1 answer key objection window 2024 deadline extended: Check details here
description: The SSC has extended the objection deadline for the CGL Tier 1 answer key to October 8 due to heavy server load. Candidates can check the provisional answer key on ssc.nic.in and submit challenges. The CGL Tier 1 exam took place from September 9 to September 26, 2024, with results to follow the final answer key.

title: JEECUP Counselling 2024 Round 7 (special round) choice filling process begins: Check direct link here
description: The Joint Entrance Examination Council Uttar Pradesh has begun the choice-filling process for Round 7 (Special Round). Candidates can register and fill choices at jeecup.admissions.nic.in. The seat allotment result will be announced on October 7, 2024, and document verification will occur from October 8 to October 10, 2024. Check important details here.

title: Delhi University permits students to pursue dual degrees simultaneously at its colleges, departments
description: Delhi University now allows students to pursue two degree programmes simultaneously—one in regular mode and the other through Open and Distance Learning (ODL). Students must complete academic requirements separately for both degrees, including mandatory courses. However, compulsory courses from the first programme will replace similar requirements in the second, ensuring no duplication. Dual credits cannot be combined for a major or minor.

title: Goa education board reschedules Class 12 board exams dates for JEE 2025 – Check details
description: The Goa Board said the decision has been taken to accommodate requests from several higher secondary schools, parents, and local representatives, who raised concerns regarding the limited preparation time available for the board exams

title: AP TET 2024: Answer Key for Day 1 exam to be OUT today at aptet.apcfss.in; Check 5-steps to download here
description: AP TET Answer Key 2024: Candidates who appeared for the exam can download the AP TET day 1 answer keys from the official website aptet.apcfss.in.

title: Mint Primer | IIT hiring: Will it be a rocky one for the batch of ’25?
description: Colleges are pursuing firms and aren’t waiting for them to contact the campus. Knowing that high-paying recruiters may head for the established IITs and the NITs, others colleges are pursuing new firms, while reaching out to their alumni for help.

title: SSC CGL 2024 answer key OUT for tier 1 exam at ssc.gov.in. Direct link, objection date and other details
description: SSC CGL 2024 Answer Key: The SSC on Thursday released the answer keys of the tier 1 exam of the CGL conducted between Sept 9 and 26. Candidates who appeared for the exam can check and download the answer keys of all the papers at SSC official website at ssc.gov.in

title: BTEUP Result 2024 OUT at bteup.ac.in. Direct link, how to download
description: BTEUP Result 2024: The BTEUP has released the results for the annual, even semester and back paper exams held in June 2024. Students who have participated in the above-mentioned exams can check and download their results online at the official website of BTEUP at www.bteup.ac.in

title: GATE 2025 registration ends tomorrow at gate2025.iitr.ac.in. Direct link, other details
description: GATE 2025: The IIT Roorkee—the nodal institute to organise the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE)-2025—will conclude the registration process for admission to postgraduate engineering programmes on October 3 at gate2025.iitr.ac.in

title: Prime Minister internship portal set to go live soon. Check stipend, key dates and other details
description: Under this scheme, the candidates will will get an opportunity to work in the top 500 companies of India. The interns will be entitled to receive monthly stipend of  ₹5000 as well as one time financial assistance of  ₹6,000.

title: IIT JAM 2025 registration ends on Oct 11 at jam2025.iitd.ac.in. Eligibility, how to apply
description: IIT JAM 2025: IIT Delhi is scheduled to close the application registration window for the JAM 2025 on October 11. Interested candidates who have not yet applied can visit the official website at jam2025.iitd.ac.in to register for the exam

title: IITs chase recruiters to avoid a repeat of last year's scramble
description: Last year, some of the recruiters included Google India, Apple, Microsoft India, Procter and Gamble, Sony Japan, Texas Instruments, Qualcomm, Tata group, Ola and Reliance Industries

title: SC uses extraordinary power to help Dalit student, asks IIT Dhanbad to grant him admission
description: The Supreme Court used its extraordinary powers under Article 142 of the Constitution in asking the IIT Dhanbad to admit Atul Kumar into its Electrical Engineering B-Tech course

title: MP ITI admission: Last date today to register for ITI Sabalgarh; direct link, steps to apply and other details here
description: MP ITI admission: The Madhya Pradesh Directorate of Skill Development will close the MP ITI admission application portal today, September 30. Candidates seeking admission to Government ITI Sabalgarh must register online and complete the process by Monday.

title: WBJEE ANM and GNM Result 2024 out at wbjeeb.nic.in. Direct link, how to download rank card
description: The WBJEEB on Tuesday declared the results for the Common Entrance Test ANM(R) &amp; GNM-2024. Candidates who participated in the exam can check their results and download their rank card from the official WBJEEB websites at www.wbjeeb.nic.in and www.wbjeeb.in

title: Canada cuts study permit by 10% for 2025, updates rules. Here's how it'll impact Indian students
description: In 2025, Canada will cut its international student study permit cap by 10%, impacting Indian students who constitute a large portion of enrolments. The target will be 437,000 permits, down from 485,000 in 2024, amidst rising concerns about system abuse and foreign worker regulations.

title: Assam heatwave: Schools in Kamrup Metro to stay closed for 4 days, timings changed as mercury soars — check details
description: The district elementary education officer has said various incidents of ill-health and fainting of students have been reported from multiple schools due to excessive heat and dehydration.

title: Assam Police Recruitment 2024: Admit card OUT on slprbassam.in. Know steps to download and more details here
description: Assam Police Recruitment 2024: The Assam Police has released the admit card for the Constable PST and PET on September 23. The tests are scheduled to start on October 3, 2024, and admit cards can be downloaded from the SLPRB website.

title: India to award 50 Quad scholarships worth  ₹4 crore; Details here
description: PM Modi in US: These scholarships will be awarded to students from the Indo-Pacific who aim to pursue undergraduate engineering program at government-funded technical institution in India.

title: Assam news: School timings change in Dibrugarh, Kamrup, Cachar, other districts amid heatwaves, govt issues guidelines
description: Assam news: A government issued guidelines for schools in the Dibrugarh, Sonitpur, Kamrup and other districts. One of the orders said, “School hours may start early and end accordingly. Classes may begin from 8.00 AM onwards.”

title: CTET 2024 examination rescheduled, check new date, other details here
description: CTET 2024: The CBSE has rescheduled the examination date for the Central Teacher Eligibility Test (CTET) 2024 due to administrative reasons. Now, he exam will be conducted on December 15. Earlier, the exam was scheduled to be held on December 1

title: India's best schools unveiled: Noida's ‘Step by Step’ tops Cfore rankings 2024. Check full list here
description: C fore's survey ranked top schools in India across 16 categories after assessing them on 14 key parameters. The survey was conducted in 92 cities across the country from March to July 2024.

title: Canada's cut on foreign student quota may force Indian aspirants to try options in East Europe
description: The Canadian government's decision to dial down on the number of permits given to international students by more than one-third has left aspirants from India in the lurch. Consultants estimate Eastern European countries may become more attractive destinations.

title: UPSC Main 2024 exam today: Schedule, timing, guidelines and more - Everything you need to know
description: UPSC Main 2024 exam today: The UPSC Main 2024 exam starts today, September 20, with over eight lakh candidates participating.&nbsp;

title: RSMSSB CET Admit Card 2024 to be OUT today; 5 steps to download Rajasthan CET hall ticket at rsmssb.rajasthan.gov.in
description: RSMSSB CET Admit Card 2024: RSSB will release the RSMSSB CET admit cards today for the Graduate-Level Common Entrance Test. Candidates can access hall tickets online for the exams scheduled on September 27 and 28.

title: UPSC Main 2024 Exam on September 20: Here's a full list of guidelines and what not to carry
description: The UPSC Main exam will be held on Friday for over eight lakh candidates. Entry requires an e-Admit Card, while mobile phones and electronic devices are banned. Candidates must arrive on time, as entry closes 30 minutes before the exam starts.

title: Telangana Open SSC, Intermediate exam dates OUT at telanganaopenschool.org; 4 steps to check TOSS exam schedule here
description: Telangana Open School Society has announced the timetable for SSC and Intermediate exams from, starting with language tests. Check full schedule here.

title: SSC MTS Admit Card 2024 released at ssc.gov.in: Check Havaldar application status, other details here
description: SSC MTS Admit Card 2024 released: The multi tasking (non-technical) staff, and havaldar (cbic &amp; cbn) examination, 2024 will be held from September 30 to November 14. Check more details here.

title: India Post GDS Result 2024 merit list 2 out! Here's how to download, official website, and more
description: India Post has released the second merit list for Gramin Dak Sevak recruitment 2024 for 44,228 vacancies, excluding Haryana and Jammu &amp; Kashmir.

title: International schools see rapid growth in tier 2 & 3 Indian cities
description: These swish schools with tuition fees that range upwards of  ₹7-9 lakh per annum are now offering specially trained teachers, some roped in from abroad, infrastructure that can compete with counterparts in metros.

title: Faddish thinking is hobbling education in the rich world
description: Test scores have been stagnant or worse for more than a decade

title: CAT 2024 registration last date extended till Sept 20. Check eligibility, how to register at iimcat.ac.in
description: CAT 2024: The IIM Calcutta has extended the last date to register for the CAT 2024 to September 20 until 5 PM. Eligible aspirants can fill out the online CAT application form 2024 via the official website of CAT 2024 at iimcat.ac.in

title: UGC NET June 2024 answer key objection window for Aug 27- Sept 5 Exam closes tomorrow at ugcnet.nta.ac.in
description: UGC NET June 2024: The National Testing Agency (NTA) on Friday extended the last date to challenge the UGC NET June 2024 answer key till Saturday for the exams held from Aug 27- Sept 5 in a CBT format across the nation&nbsp;

title: CSIR UGC NET 2024 results OUT at csirnet.nta.ac.in. Direct link, how to download scorecard
description: CSIR UGC NET 2024 results: The NTA has released scorecards for the Joint CSIR-UGC NET Examination July 2024. Candidates&nbsp;who appeared for the exam conducted on July 25, 26 and 27 can check and download their results on the official website of CSIR UGC NET at csirnet.nta.ac.in

title: CAT 2024: Last chance to register for November 24 exam; follow THESE 6 easy steps to apply now at iimcat.ac.in
description: CAT 2024 Registration: Candidates can register for the IIM Calcutta exam through the official website at iimcat.ac.in. The deadline to submit application form is 5:00 PM on September 13

title: IAS aspirants to retain control over their credentials under govt's new ad norms
description: The Central Consumer Protection Authority will soon order IAS coaching centres to cease the practice of requiring aspirants to sign agreements at the time of enrolment, allowing the use of their credentials—such as photos, rank, video clips, or messages—claiming success in the prestigious UPSC exam.

title: Punjab government promoting 300 English lecturers starts uproar as they have zero expertise in the subject: Report
description: Over 300 teachers in Punjab were promoted to English lecturers for classes 11 and 12, but only three have expertise in the language. Most promoted teachers previously taught other subjects, highlighting a shortage of qualified English educators in government schools.

title: UPPBPB UP Police Constable Answer Key 2024 OUT: Check the download link for August 23 exam answer key on uppbpb.gov.in.
description: UPPBPB UP Police Constable Answer Key 2024 has been released on Wednesday. Know how to download the provisional answer key on uppbpb.gov.in.

title: West Asia crisis hits Iran's status as favoured place for higher studies among Kashmiri families
description: Families of Kashmiri students in Iran are anxious amid rising West Asia tensions, particularly with the Israel-Hezbollah and Israel-Hamas conflicts. Many fear for the safety of their children and are reconsidering sending them for higher studies there. Career consultancies report a significant drop in student admissions to Iran. Parents and consultancies stay connected to ensure students' safety.

title: New F-1 visa rules pose challenges for international students in the US
description: Recent changes to F-1 visa regulations impose stricter limits on how long international students can spend outside the US, restricting them to a maximum of five consecutive months during their academic programs. This poses challenges for students aiming to participate in study abroad programs, internships, and research projects, potentially forcing them to forgo valuable international experiences.

title: Indian student applications to Australia plummet: What's behind the dramatic dip in numbers
description: Applications from Indian students, the second largest source of international students in Australia, have fallen by 66 percent, according to The Sydney Morning Herald. Overall, overseas student applications have halved since the introduction of higher fees and stricter regulations in July, raising concerns among universities about potential economic impacts.

title: France wants to host 30,000 Indian students in the coming year
description: The French Ambassador to India, Thierry Mathou, announced France's goal to host 30,000 Indian students in the coming year, emphasizing the importance of enhancing people-to-people exchanges in the bilateral relationship. This initiative aligns with President Macron's earlier commitment made during his visit to India in January.

title: Applying for a UK Student visa? Here’s all you need to know
description: To study in the UK, students aged 16 or older need to apply for a Student visa or Child Student visa. Application timings vary depending on whether you're inside or outside the UK. The duration of stay depends on the course level. Fees and healthcare surcharges apply.

title: UK universities' tuition fees set to spike: What it means for students
description: UK university tuition fees for domestic students are set to increase for the first time in seven years due to a financial crisis affecting about 40% of higher-education providers. Institutions are advocating for fees to be indexed to inflation to prevent further erosion of their value, as current funding levels are at their lowest in two decades.

title: Why Ivy leagues have an Indian problem?
description: In a recent interview, Malcolm Gladwell addressed the bias against Asian-American and Indian students in Ivy League admissions, particularly at Harvard. He criticized Harvard's practices for favoring affluent white students and compared its admissions process with Caltech's merit-based approach, highlighting that the percentage of Asian-American students at Caltech rose from 25% to 43% between 1992 and 2013, while Harvard's percentage remained at 15-20%.

title: What is India Young Professionals Scheme visa?
description: Indian citizens aged 18 to 30 can apply for the India Young Professionals Scheme visa to live and work in the UK for up to two years. Applicants must be selected through a ballot, have an eligible qualification, and show savings of £2,530. Successful applicants must apply within 90 days and travel to the UK within six months.

title: UK universities push for tuition fee hike
description: UK universities have proposed a reform package aimed at increasing participation among under-25s to 70% by 2040, enhancing the economy, training healthcare professionals, and supporting net-zero initiatives. The report by Universities UK calls for increased public funding to shift the financial burden from students to the government and suggests that tuition fees be linked to inflation to maintain their real-term value.

title: Canada's new project to streamline review process for rejected study permits: Eligibility, how to apply?
description: If your Canadian study permit was rejected, you may soon benefit from Canada’s new Study Permit Pilot Project launching on October 1. This initiative aims to expedite the judicial review process for rejected study permit applications, potentially reducing processing times from 14-18 months to under five months.

title: Study hard or go home? Canada tightens immigration rules for students
description: Canada's immigration minister, Marc Miller, announced that the cap on international students will remain in place with new measures to manage temporary resident arrivals. Changes include modifications to the post-graduate work programme and spousal work eligibility, impacting Indian students significantly. These measures aim to reduce the share of temporary residents by 2025.

title: QS global MBA rankings 2025: Top 10 business schools in the world revealed
description: The QS Full-Time MBA Rankings 2025 highlight 340 leading business schools from 58 countries, showcasing both full-time MBA and popular Business Master's programs. The United States continues to dominate, securing the top three spots, with Stanford Graduate School of Business ranked first for the fifth consecutive year, followed by The Wharton School and Harvard Business School.

title: Here’s how much it will cost you to study at some of Canada’s top universities
description: Canada has emerged as a top destination for international students due to its cultural diversity and prestigious universities, with an average annual tuition of CAD 40,115 for full-time undergraduates in 2024. Notable institutions include the University of Toronto, ranked 25th globally, where tuition ranges from CAD 61,720 to CAD 67,370, and living costs in downtown Toronto can reach CAD 3,000 per month. McGill University in Montreal offers a lower cost of living, with tuition at CAD 47,281.69 for Arts and rent averaging CAD 2,300 monthly.

title: Prodigy Finance announces $5,000 scholarship for Jan 2025 intake students: All you need to know
description: Prodigy Finance has announced a $5,000 scholarship for students pursuing higher education abroad for the Spring 2025 intake. Applications open in September 2024 and close on September 30, 2024. Eligible candidates must be accepted into a Prodigy Finance-supported program and demonstrate academic excellence and community commitment.

title: What happens if your US student visa is cancelled?
description: Securing a US student visa is just the beginning for international students. Maintaining it is crucial, as violations like prolonged absence, unauthorized transfer, or fraudulent activities can lead to revocation. Immediate steps include understanding the reason, contacting university services, reapplying or appealing, and seeking legal assistance if necessary.

title: The pitfalls of cheating on your TOEFL or GRE test
description: Using unethical means to gain university admission can lead to severe consequences, including visa cancellation and deportation. Sachin Jain of ETS India & South Asia emphasizes the importance of academic integrity. Recent enhancements to the TOEFL test aim to help students prepare better and reduce stress during the exam process.

title: Navigating Global Education: Visa caps, financial strain, and the future of higher learning for Indian students
description: Indian students face new challenges in studying abroad due to policy changes in the UK and Canada. Visa restrictions, rising costs, and uncertain post-study work opportunities are reshaping their options. However, aligning academic goals with emerging industries and careful financial planning can help navigate these uncertainties.

title: Canada, Australia, UK visa curbs set to hit Indian students hard; new destinations like Germany, France, Spain in focus
description: With Canada, Australia, and the UK tightening study visa rules, a decline in Indian students is expected for spring 2025. Students may opt for alternative destinations like Germany, France, and Spain. However, the increased intake in these countries is unlikely to fully compensate for the anticipated decline in traditional destinations.

title: UK hikes international student maintenance requirements
description: The UK has increased the financial savings requirements for international students for the first time since 2020. Starting January 2, 2025, students coming to London must show evidence of £1,483 per month, while those studying elsewhere in the UK will need £1,136 per month. The current requirements are £1,334 for London and £1,023 for other areas.

title: Canada's international student commencements likely to drop by 50% this year
description: In January, Canada announced a temporary cap on study visas for international students, leading to a projected 35% decrease in approved study permits for 2024, with an estimated 364,000 permits issued. The ICEF Monitor reports a 54% drop in new study permit applications in Q2 2024 compared to Q2 2023, with a projected 39% annual decline.

title: Rich Indians are dipping into their savings to send their kids abroad for education
description: A survey reveals that over three-fourth of wealthy Indians are keen on sending their children overseas for education. The United States, United Kingdom, and Canada are the top destinations. Parents are willing to face financial strains, even dipping into retirement savings, to ensure quality education for their children.

title: Indian students continue to lead in Germany's international students enrollment
description: Germany remains a top destination for Indian students, who now make up the largest international student group in the country for the second consecutive year. According to the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD), the number of Indian students has more than doubled in the past five years, reaching 49,483 for the Winter Semester 2023-2024, marking a 15.1% increase over the previous year.

title: Australia's reputation as a go-to destination for foreign students is tanking. All thanks to their new rules
description: Australia's global reputation for high-quality tertiary education could be at risk due to proposed caps on international student numbers, according to Universities Australia Chair David Lloyd. The center-left Labor government's plan aims to limit foreign student places to 270,000 for 2025, with 175,000 for higher education and 95,000 for skills colleges.

title: 7 reasons to pick New Zealand as Australia tightens rules for international students
description: Australia's decision to cap international student enrolments at 270,000 by 2025 may benefit New Zealand as a study destination. With lower visa fees, affordable living costs, and globally recognized qualifications, New Zealand offers an attractive alternative for Indian students seeking higher education abroad.

title: Resident OCI cardholders eligible for loans to study abroad, says RBI
description: The Reserve Bank of India has clarified that Overseas Citizens of India (OCI) cardholders residing in India are eligible for education loans for studies abroad. However, OCIs residing outside India can only get loans from Indian banks for studying within the country. This clarification came after banks sought guidance on the matter.

title: UK universities say visa curbs for international students are hitting them in the pocket
description: Restrictions on visas for international students is causing financial hardship for UK universities, they said on Thursday, calling for a hike in domestic tuition fees to offset yawning deficits. Typically, international students pay more in tuition fees than their domestic counterparts and have become a lucrative source of income for many institutions.

title: Surviving and Thriving: A comprehensive guide for international students
description: Studying abroad is a thrilling yet challenging journey. International students must adapt to new environments, understand local regulations, upskill in AI and Data Analytics, build their personal brand, manage finances wisely, avoid plagiarism, engage in community activities, and utilize university resources effectively for a successful experience.

title: Forbes lists top 10 universities in the US
America's top 10 universities in 2024
description: For the second consecutive year, Princeton University has topped Forbes' list of America's leading colleges and universities, excelling across all 14 metrics used to evaluate educational quality, financial support, and career outcomes. Notably, Princeton boasts a 97% six-year graduation rate for low-income students. The list also saw Rice University make a significant leap, debuting in the top ten at #9, thanks to its low student debt levels.

title: Studying Abroad? Insurers go the extra mile to cover risks
description: Insurance companies are adapting their products to meet the needs of the growing number of Indian students studying abroad. This year, 1.33 million Indians are pursuing higher studies overseas. Increased geopolitical risks and healthcare costs have led insurers like HDFC Ergo, Tata AIG, and ICICI Lombard to offer customized and comprehensive insurance plans. Flexible policies now cover medical expenses, accommodation, and return travel costs, aiming to rival university policies often at a lower cost.

title: US issues new guidelines on OPT eligibility, grace periods, and study abroad for international STEM students
description: The USCIS has issued new guidelines for F and M nonimmigrant students regarding STEM OPT extensions. The revisions cover online study allowances, school transfers, grace periods, and study abroad programs. Effective immediately, these updates apply to all pending and future requests, clarifying several essential rules for international students.

title: International students struggling with poor English still earning master’s degrees in UK: Report
description: A blog by two anonymous professors claims many international students at British universities lack essential English language skills but still obtain degrees. They highlight issues in master's programs, citing poor class engagement and reliance on translation apps. This problem risks UK's higher education standing.

title: How Canadian dream has turned into a gamble for Indian students
description: Canada's pathway to permanent residency for international students and temporary foreign workers, especially from Punjab, is facing disruptions due to unemployment and economic issues. Protests have erupted as the government caps foreign worker numbers, affecting students and workers seeking permanent residency.

title: 7 top-ranked Australian Universities for international students
description: Australia has attracted international students with its top-notch education system, post-study opportunities, and strong faculty support. Notable universities include the University of Melbourne, UNSW, University of Sydney, ANU, Monash University, University of Queensland, and UWA, all part of the prestigious Group of Eight. These universities offer diverse programs, research initiatives, and excellent career prospects.

title: Australia will only accept 270,000 international student enrollments in 2025
description: Australia will cap international student enrollments at 270,000 in 2025 to tackle record migration levels impacting home rental prices. Reforms aim for sustainability in the international student sector, following measures to phase out COVID-era concessions. The country saw a 60% surge in net immigration, fueling housing market pressures.

title: This Canadian province has paused colleges from launching new international programs
description: The Ontario government has imposed a ban on colleges and universities entering new contracts or agreements to offer post-secondary programs abroad. Outgoing Minister of Colleges and Universities, Jill Dunlop, announced the moratorium in a memo, emphasizing the need for institutions to concentrate on their primary mission of serving Ontarians and supporting local communities.

title: Visa figures reveal Indian students being put off applying to UK universities
description: India tops UK's student visa grants tally, despite a 23% decline amid tighter migration curbs. Indian students remain the largest group on the Graduate Route visa, but curbs on bringing dependents affect numbers. UK's education sector faces challenges, while Indian travel and work visa trends also see changes.

title: UK, Canada & Australia losing popularity among international students
description: Studyportals' recent research reveals a growing shift among prospective international students away from Australia, Canada, and the UK, largely due to restrictive immigration policies in these countries. Interest in on-campus programs in Canada and the UK saw an initial rise in January 2024 but then dropped sharply from February to July 2024, particularly for Canada.

title: UK's clampdown on international students has exposed how much universities depend on foreign money
description: Britain's university funding model is in turmoil as many institutions report deficits. The crisis intensified after a drop in international students, prompted by stricter visa rules. Labour suggested addressing the issue but lacked specifics. Proposed solutions include adjusting tuition fees, easing visa restrictions, and seeking alternative income streams to ensure long-term viability.

title: Working in the US as a student: On-campus jobs, OPT, CPT, and visa rules explained
description: Working in the United States as a student offers financial benefits and practical skill development, but requires careful navigation of visa regulations. F1 visa holders can work on-campus without USCIS approval, but must ensure jobs align with their visa status and academic goals. Optional Practical Training (OPT) allows for off-campus work related to a student's major, while Curricular Practical Training (CPT) is for work integral to their academic program.

title: Visa restrictions on international students remain set in stone under UK's new Labour government
description: The UK's ruling Labour Party has confirmed it will not reverse the Conservative government's restrictive student visa policies. Labour's education secretary, Bridget Phillipson, stated that the government does not plan to lift the visa restrictions on international students. She acknowledged the significant contribution of international students but criticized the previous Conservative administration for its approach to higher education.

title: Poland tightens visa rules for international students to prevent abuse
description: Poland has changed its visa rules to require international students to have high school diplomas, aiming to curb the misuse of student visas for illegal work in the EU. This decision follows a scandal involving foreigners obtaining visas without meeting university requirements and using them for work.

title: Heading to Singapore to study? You can bring your mum, dad, or even your grandmother along
description: Singapore's policies let international students to bring along parents or grandparents during studies. According to new rules, male guardians, including fathers and grandfathers, can now apply for long-term visit passes.

title: From Golden Goose to Sitting Ducks: International students are caught in immigration crosshairs
description: The UK, Netherlands, Canada, and Australia have all imposed tougher restrictions on international students to curb immigration, impacting university finances and local economies. These policy shifts occur amid rising domestic opposition to immigration, with the US emerging as a potential beneficiary due to increased international student enrollments.

title: EducationUSA fairs across 8 Indian cities from August 16-25
description: The US higher education sector is hosting a series of EducationUSA Fairs across India from August 16 to August 25. The fairs will visit eight cities—Hyderabad, Chennai, Bangalore, Kolkata, Ahmedabad, Pune, Mumbai, and New Delhi—over 10 days. They offer students an opportunity to connect with representatives from over 80 accredited US universities and colleges for information on admissions, scholarships, and campus life.

title: Decoding Student Housing: Why purpose-built accommodations matter for international students
description: The number of Indian students studying abroad had steadily grown, with a forecast to reach around 1.5 million students by 2025. This rise drove demand for Purpose-Built Student Accommodation (PBSA), which offered tailored living experiences, modern amenities, and high security. Students preferred PBSAs for their convenience and community-focused lifestyle both on-campus and off-campus.

title: New Zealand announces significant visa fee increases from October; student visas to get costlier too
description: New Zealand announced visa fee increases, effective 1 October 2024, to make the immigration system sustainable. The new fees will lessen taxpayer burdens and shift costs to visa applicants. Student visa fees will double but remain lower than Australia's. New Zealand experienced a rise in international student enrolments in 2023, driven mostly by students from China and India.

title: US colleges are cutting majors and slashing programs after years of putting it off
description: During the pandemic, fewer students attended college; nonetheless, officials assumed that attendance would rebound to pre-COVID levels and had used federal relief funds to support their budgets while this was happening, he said.

title: For some, college degree at home is new study abroad
description: International education has become less attractive for Indian students due to tighter visa policies, political unrest, and economic slowdowns in several countries. Indian colleges are emerging as safer and more appealing options. Study abroad platforms are adjusting their business focus to cater to these changing preferences and the growing quality of domestic education.

title: Indians lead in UK university enrollments amid decline in overall migration
description: Indians have maintained the lead as the largest group of foreign students in UK universities, accounting for 26% of non-EU students in the 2022-23 academic year, according to Higher Education Statistics Agency (HESA) data. This surge is attributed to the Graduate Route visa, which allows graduates to stay in the UK for two years to work or seek employment.

title: Vance and Walz Embrace Cheaper Child Care in a Rare Moment of Agreement in the Campaign
description: Both vice-presidential candidates say the government should spend more on child care, a rare point of agreement. But there are still major differences in how they talk about families and gender roles.

title: They Paid Thousands for a Caltech Boot Camp. Caltech Didn’t Teach It.
description: Hundreds of universities have lent their names to online programs, plugging budgets but alienating students who feel misled.

title: A Plan to Fund High School Newspapers Seeks to Revive Student Journalism
description: Just 27 percent of public high schools in New York City have a newspaper. A local nonprofit is offering a solution.

title: What to Know About Melissa Aviles-Ramos, New York City’s New Schools Chancellor
description: Melissa Aviles-Ramos, a former English teacher and deputy chancellor, will assume the post after David C. Banks steps down in December.

title: As School Threats Proliferate, More Than 700 Students Are
description: The number of threats after a Georgia school shooting this month is much higher than usual, many officials said. In response, some have cracked down with arrests and detention for children as young as 10.

title: Brandeis President Steps Amid Trouble with Finances and Protests
description: The university has seen major drops in enrollment, even as the president invited students concerned about protests and antisemitism on other campuses to transfer.

title: U.S. News & World Report Released Its College Rankings
description: Every year, U.S. News & World Report publishes rankings that often change very little, though they draw attention and frustration from universities and applicants.

title: David Banks, New York City’s Schools Chancellor, to Resign
description: The resignation of Mr. Banks, planned for the end of the year, comes amid a flurry of federal investigations into Mayor Eric Adams and his administration.

title: Report on Antisemitism at CUNY Calls for Changes Across the System
description: The report, commissioned by New York’s governor, found that the city’s university system was ill-equipped to handle rising antisemitism. But it also said the problem was not widespread.

title: Penn Suspends Amy Wax, Law Professor Accused of Making Racist Statements
description: The case tested the limits of academic freedom and tenure.

title: University of Maryland to Review Plagiarism Claims Against President Darryll J. Pines
description: The university’s president, Darryll J. Pines, who studies aerospace engineering, was accused of copying significant portions of a paper in 2002.

title: Rutgers President Announces Resignation After a Year Rocked by Protests
description: Jonathan Holloway was Rutgers’ first Black president. He helped the university grow but also faced criticism and questioning in Congress over pro-Palestinian encampments on campus.

title: Social Studies Teachers Rely on Online and Sometimes Ideological Sources
description: A survey of social studies teachers found that many find primary sources online for lesson plans. But a notable minority also rely on left-leaning materials, and a handful have turned to conservative options.

title: N.Y.C. Schools Chancellor Seeks to Project Stability as Inquiries Swirl
description: David C. Banks, whose phone was seized during an investigation related to his brother, largely avoided discussing his current circumstances in his annual State of Our Schools speech.

title: Yale, Princeton, Duke Are Questioned Over Decline in Asian Students
description: The legal group that won a Supreme Court case that ended race-based college admissions suggested it might sue schools where the percentage of Asian students fell.

title: Why Some Christians Don’t Want to Bring the Bible Into Public Schools
description: As the idea of incorporating the Bible into classrooms gains traction, concerns about the mission of public schools — and differences across the faith — have led even some conservative Christians to push back.

title: What to Know About How an Affirmative Action Ban Affected Colleges
description: Here is what we know about the effects of the Supreme Court’s decision curtailing race-based admissions at selective universities. And why many experts and administrators are baffled.

title: Harvard’s Black Student Enrollment Declines After Affirmative Action
description: Defying expectations, a Supreme Court decision curtailing race-based admissions still had a relatively small impact at some highly selective schools like Harvard, even as other schools saw big changes.

title: Donald Trump Wants to Shut Down the Department of Education. Can He?
description: Donald Trump has argued he would use the department to further his priorities — or close it. But the agency has relatively limited power, and any plan to shutter it would face major hurdles.

title: U.N.C. Reports Declines in Black and Hispanic Enrollment
description: Along with Harvard University, the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill was one of two schools defending affirmative action in Supreme Court cases last year.

title: NYC Schools Chief Says Migrants Have Been a ‘Godsend’
description: In an interview, Chancellor David C. Banks said migrants had helped schools that were bleeding students. He also promised a big new role for artificial intelligence.

title: Federal Judge Temporarily Blocks Another Pillar of Biden’s Student Debt Plan
description: The plan would affect millions of borrowers struggling with runaway interest and others who were still paying off loans after decades. It was set to take effect this fall.

title: A Campus Protest Movement Seeks to Regain Momentum but Faces Hurdles
description: Pro-Palestinian demonstrations appeared at some U.S. campuses, but new restrictions and a new set of students may slow momentum for the type of mass protests seen in the spring.

title: Black Enrollment Drops at 2 Elite Colleges Post-Affirmative Action
description: Amherst College and Tufts University saw drops in the number of Black students after a Supreme Court decision ending affirmative action. At other schools, the picture is murkier.

title: Trump to Speak at Moms for Liberty Convention
description: Last year, the former president told the group it was time to “liberate our children from the Marxist lunatics and perverts” in education. Does that message still resonate with voters?

title: Where Does Biden’s Student Loan Debt Plan Stand? Here’s What to Know.
description: The Supreme Court refused to allow a key part of President Biden’s student debt plan to move forward. Here’s what’s left of it, and who could still benefit.

title: University of Virginia Suspends Tours Criticized for Emphasizing Ties to Slavery
description: A group of conservative alumni said the student-led tours were overly focused on the school’s history of using enslaved laborers.

title: At UMichigan, Pro-Palestinian Protesters Shut Down Student Government
description: Pro-Palestinian protesters won council elections, and have refused to fund campus groups, like the men’s Ultimate Frisbee team, unless their divestment demands are met.

title: Cellphone Bans in Schools? NYC Is ‘Not There Yet,’ Mayor Says
description: Districts and states across the United States have supported restrictions on student usage, but New York City’s leaders are backing away from the idea because of logistical concerns.

title: How College Campuses Are Trying to Manage Protests During an Election Year
description: University officials are spelling out strict codes around protests. They say they are trying to be clear. Others say they are trying to suppress speech.

title: At M.I.T., Black and Latino Enrollment Drops Sharply After Affirmative Action Ban
description: Asian American students made up almost half of the 2028 class — the first admitted since the end of affirmative action.

title: Inside the Fall of Columbia University’s President, Nemat Shafik
description: Nemat Shafik was vilified on almost all sides for her handling of the protests over the Israel-Hamas war. When given an offramp, she took it.

title: Katrina Armstrong Appointed Columbia University’s Interim President
description: Dr. Katrina A. Armstrong replaces Nemat Shafik as president of one of the most turbulent campuses in America.

title: Harvard Names Conservative Legal Scholar as Permanent Provost
description: John F. Manning has served as interim provost since March, and is considered a top contender for university president.

title: Maurie McInnis, Yale’s New President, Emphasized Policing at Previous Post
description: In her four years at the state university, Maurie McInnis drew criticism from faculty members who said some of her decisions violated academic freedom.

title: Oklahoma’s State Superintendent Requires Public Schools to Teach the Bible
description: The state superintendent, Ryan Walters, said the Bible was a “necessary historical document.” The mandate comes as part of a conservative movement to infuse Christian values in public schools.

title: Northwestern Law School Accused of Bias Against White Men in Hiring
description: The lawsuit was filed a year after the Supreme Court struck down the use of racial and gender preferences in college admissions.

title: Bloomberg’s $1 Billion Gift of Free Medical School Tuition Only Applies to Some
description: A donation from Bloomberg Philanthropies will provide free tuition for Johns Hopkins medical students, if their families make less than $300,000 a year.

title: Harvard’s Antisemitism and Anti-Muslim Task Forces Find Climate of Bias
description: Groups investigating antisemitism and anti-Muslim bias cited instances of discrimination against pro-Israel students and “a pervasive climate of intolerance” against pro-Palestinian students.

title: Why U.S. Schools Are Facing Their Biggest Budget Crunch in Years
description: Federal pandemic aid helped keep school districts afloat, but that money is coming to an end.

title: Schools Got a Record $190 Billion in Pandemic Aid. Did It Work?
description: Two new studies suggest that the largest single federal investment in U.S. schools improved student test scores, but only modestly.

title: A School With 7 Students: Inside the ‘Microschools’ Movement
description: Parents, desperate for help, are turning to private schools with a half-dozen or so students. And they are getting a financial boost from taxpayers.

title: Newsom Calls for Ban on Smartphone Use in California Schools
description: Gov. Gavin Newsom called for a statewide ban as states and large school districts have pursued similar prohibitions to prevent disruption and cyberbullying.

title: Penn Bans Encampments After Wave of Campus Protests Over War in Gaza
description: The new rules, which would also significantly rein in demonstrations at the university in other ways, come on the heels of a nationwide wave of student activism against Israel’s actions in Gaza.

title: Is This the End for Mandatory D.E.I. Statements?
description: Harvard and M.I.T. no longer require applicants for teaching jobs to explain how they would serve underrepresented groups. Other schools may follow.

title: U.C. Berkeley’s Leader, a Free Speech Champion, Has Advice for Today’s Students: Tone It Down
description: “Just because you have the right to say something doesn’t mean it’s right to say,” said Carol Christ, who is retiring as chancellor at the end of this month.

title: Private schools say fewer pupils starting secondary
description: The Independent Schools Council says some members reported a drop in pupils starting secondary school.

title: Eye and ear checks to be offered to autistic students at school
description: An NHS scheme is bringing checks into special schools to help identify issues sooner.

title: GCSE students to continue receiving Covid exam help
description: The education secretary says equation sheets should be available to students sitting exams in 2025, 2026 and 2027.

title: Sex charge tutor case reveals ‘massive' safeguarding hole
description: A man charged with sexual assault has been advertising as a private tutor for children, the BBC finds.

title: 'You're sending them into the lion's den'
description: Parents say children have been shouted at in class for movements and sounds they cannot control.

title: Lack of emphasis on teaching water safety - head
description: Head teacher Gary Gentle says children are "not taught enough" about self-safe rescue.

title: Prison education failing young offenders - Ofsted
description: Some children in young offender institutions spend 23 hours per day in their cells, a report says.

title: The town pushing to delay smartphones for children
description: William Ransom Primary School is inviting all the towns schools to join their smartphone pledge.

title: The debate: Should smartphones be banned for under 16s?
description: How much are smartphones harming children and what should we do about it? BBC InDepth hosts a debate between a campaigner and an academic.

title: The shopping centre helping students feel at home
description: Leeds' Merrion Centre is promoting itself on Chinese social media to its growing East Asian clientele.

title: 'I lost two years of income when my son had to miss school'
description: Kirsti Hadley described her business as "my second baby" - but now relies on benefits to make ends meet.

title: The big changes coming for private schools
description: The Labour government's changes will come into effect in January 2025

title: How much does uni cost in the UK and is it worth it?
description: Given higher costs, some students wonder whether going to university makes financial sense.

title: Everything you need to know about student loans
description: How do I get my first student loan payment, what can I borrow and when do I have to start paying it back?

title: Tamil Nadu schools reopen today after extended quarterly-holidays amid heavy rain warnings for 15 districts
description: Tamil Nadu schools reopen today after a break for quarterly exams. The previously extended holiday period ends as students return to campuses. Evaluated exam papers and second-term textbooks are to be distributed. Schools have been advised on safety measures due to ongoing monsoon rains.

title: CM Schools of Excellence Empower Jharkhand's Underprivileged Students with World-Class Education
description: Jharkhand's CM Schools of Excellence are providing quality education to students from poor backgrounds, rivaling private institutions. With modern facilities like science labs, smart boards, and extracurricular activities, these schools are helping children like Anjali Singh succeed. Launched in May 2023, the project aims to expand from 80 to 5,000 schools, enabling underprivileged students to compete with private school peers.

title: GATE 2025 registration deadline with late fee today @gate2025.iitr.ac.in: Direct link to apply, list of required documents
description: Today is the last day to register for GATE 2025 with a late fee via gate2025.iitr.ac.in. The extended registration period ends at 11:59 PM. Candidates need to submit required documents such as a photograph, signature, and category certificates. Exam dates are February 1, 2, 15, and 16.

title: WB AYUSH UG 2024 counselling round 2 seat allotment released at wbmcc.nic.in: Check direct link and other details
description: The West Bengal Medical Counselling Committee (WBMCC) has released the WB UG AYUSH 2024 round 2 seat allotment results. Candidates can check their results on the official website. Those allotted colleges must report for document verification and fee submission on October 5 or 7. Round 3 counselling is scheduled for October 18, 2024.

title: Canada announces changes to PG work permit from November 1; check eligibility, requirements here
description: The Canadian government has announced changes to its post-graduate work permit (PGWP) for international students starting November 1, 2024. Read on to check the updated eligibility rules and other requirements here.

title: JNVST 2025 Class 6 registration last date to register today: Check apply online link to register now
description: The Navodaya Vidyalaya Samiti (NVS) will close registrations for the Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya Selection Test (JNVST) 2025 on October 7, 2024. Candidates can apply via navodaya.gov.in. Originally set for September 23, 2024, the deadline was extended. The entrance exam will be held in two phases, on January 18 and April 12, 2025, for various regions across India.

title: AP NEET PG 2024 counselling registration without late fee extended till 9 PM tonight: Check notification and details here
description: Dr. NTR University of Health Sciences (NTRUHS) in Vijayawada has extended the registration deadline for AP NEET PG 2024 counseling without late fees until 9:00 PM on October 7, 2024. Eligible candidates can register online through the official site. The registration period began on September 27, 2024, with the original deadline set for October 4, 2024.

title: ONGC Apprenticeship Recruitment 2024 registration begins: Check direct link to apply here
description: ONGC has started the online registration for its 2024 Apprentice Recruitment, offering 2,236 vacancies across multiple regions. Candidates with qualifications like BA, BCom, BBA, BE, and BTech can apply via the official website, ongcindia.com. The registration deadline is October 25, 2024, with results expected on November 15, 2024.

title: Rajasthan Opens Applications for 23,820 Safai Karmchari Posts at lsg.urban.rajasthan.gov.in; Apply Here
description: The Rajasthan Local Self Government Department has opened applications for 23,820 Safai Karmchari positions in civic bodies, with the process starting on 7th October and closing on 6th November 2024. Candidates must be permanent residents of Rajasthan and have one year of relevant experience, with an age limit of 18 to 40 years. The selection process includes a merit list by lottery, document verification, and a medical examination, aiming to enhance employment opportunities in the sanitation sector.

title: 5 Online Coding Courses Under ₹5000 for the Budding Workforce
description: As the tech industry expands, coding courses are becoming essential for aspiring professionals. These programs teach foundational programming concepts and enhance problem-solving skills, increasing employability. This article features a curated list of beginner-friendly coding courses from platforms like Udemy and Coursera, offering diverse topics such as Python, C++, and mobile coding, each designed to build confidence and expertise in coding.

title: California to ban legacy admissions at private colleges starting 2025
description: California will ban legacy preferences in private college admissions starting fall 2025. Governor Gavin Newsom signed this legislation to promote equity and merit-based admissions. This change aligns with nationwide adjustments post the Supreme Court's ruling against race-based admissions considerations.

title: Period-pain proof required for school sick days
description: The school says it is also not accepting explanations such as "unwell, poorly or ill".

title: RRB JE Exam Date 2024 Released at rrbapply.gov.in; Check official notice here
description: The Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) has released exam dates for the Junior Engineer (JE) recruitment under CEN-03/2024, scheduled from 6th to 13th December 2024. A total of 7,934 vacancies will be filled for JE, Depot Material Superintendent, and Chemical & Metallurgical Assistant posts. The RRB has also provided exam schedules for ALP, RPF-SI, and Technician roles. Candidates can download e-call letters and check exam city details on the official RRB website.

title: Berhampur University Takes Action Against 17 Students for Alleged Ragging; Hostel Evictions, Fines Imposed After UGC Complaint
description: Berhampur University in Odisha has penalized 17 post-graduate students for allegedly ragging their juniors. Following an anti-ragging committee investigation, four students were evicted from their hostel, and 13 others were fined ₹1,000 each. The action was taken after a complaint was forwarded by the UGC, with the university also issuing warnings to prevent future incidents.

title: CM Pushkar Singh Dhami Announces ₹60 Lakh Grant, Highlights Educational Reforms at Vidya Bharati Event
description: Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami, attending an event by Vidya Bharati at Govardhan Saraswati Vidya Mandir, Dharampur, announced a financial grant of ₹60 lakh for the college. He honored top students of the Uttarakhand Board Examinations and highlighted Vidya Bharati's contribution to promoting Indian culture through education. Dhami also outlined government initiatives, including scholarships, smart classes, and modernizing Uttarakhand's education system.

title: 7 govt internship opportunities students must apply for in October 2024: Eligibility, stipend and direct links here
description: In the competitive job market, internships are essential for practical experience and skill-building. This article highlights seven government internships available in October 2024, detailing opportunities with NITI Aayog, RBI, National Centre for Good Governance, Ministry of Commerce & Industry, Ministry of Law and Justice, Invest India, and the Department of Forest and Wildlife.

title: ITBP Constable Recruitment 2024: Notification for 545 driver vacancies released, application from tomorrow; Check details here
description: The Indo-Tibetan Border Police (ITBP) has announced the recruitment of 545 Constable (Driver) positions, with online applications open from 8th October to 6th November 2024. Eligible male candidates must have completed the 10th grade and possess a Heavy Motor Vehicle driving licence, with an age limit of 21 to 27 years. The pay scale for the position ranges from Rs. 21,700 to Rs. 69,100. The exam date will be notified later, with an application fee of Rs. 100.

title: Campuses Are Calmer, but They Are Not Normal, Students and Faculty Say
description: A year of war in Gaza has left college students and faculty feeling shaken and angry, with the world and with each other.

title: Hurricane Helene School Closures Could Have Long-Term Impacts
description: School closures and traumatic experiences could affect children long after schools reopen. Experts worry that similar scenarios are happening with much more frequency because of climate change.
